result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan D Meeks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 3 days were
granted if imposed.
May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid Joint and Several for Kent and Karen S. as a condition of probation. To be paid before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent. 
No Contact with co-actor or with victims Kent and Karen S. or their residence. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Complete a HSED or GED. Pay restitution in full. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.  
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Order revoking huber privileges.  Signed by Judge Carter on 03/27/17.
Dated 03/24/17, from Jail Administration requesting huber privileges be revoked for the balance of the Defendant's huber sentence.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
2nd Amended Information filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Johnathan D Meeks in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2nd amended information filed.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #2 on 2nd amended information filed today.   Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2 on 2nd amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - 3 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    *May terminate after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent*    TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - complete HSED/GED
____No contact with:  Co-actor, Donovan K. or Kent and Karen S. or their residence
____Payment of restitution owed in full

RESTITUTION:  $890.00 (Joint and Several) to Kent and Karen S.  (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 &  $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion 

 ***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Johnathan D Meeks in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Morin indicates the State will be filing an amended information and requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Jonathan D Meeks did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court received information that Defendant could not make it to court today.  Court issues a capias. Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited (previously ordered on 7/7/16)

Case called at 10:30 a.m. Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Jonathan D Meeks did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin does not know why Defendant does not appear.  Court issues a capias.  Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited.  Court cancels jury trial set for July 12, 2016.
